SUMMARY: In a closely watched survey published by Germany’s Ifo Institute, the country’s auto makers and suppliers said they were losing confidence in the European economy.

TITLE: New Antibiotic for Urinary-Tract Infections Found Effective in Trials

TITLE: Lyft Plans to Lay Off Hundreds of Employees
SUMMARY: The ride-hailing company is cutting 13% of staff, or nearly 700 jobs, the latest technology company to say it needed to reduce costs ahead of choppy economic conditions.

TITLE: Alabama's Three Largest Newspapers to Stop Printing
SUMMARY: One of the nation’s biggest publishers has decided to stop printing Alabama’s three largest newspapers next year and make them digital-only, the latest in a long string of local paper closures across America.

TITLE: Lyft to Lay Off About 700 Employees
SUMMARY: The ride-hailing company is cutting 13% of staff, the latest technology company to say it needed to reduce costs ahead of choppy economic conditions.

SUMMARY: The pharmaceutical company says its sales could be as much as $3 billion lower this year than initially expected.

SUMMARY: Twitter’s new owner often reaches across his business empire to get things done.

TITLE: Peloton's Quarterly Sales Fall Again but Losses Narrow

TITLE: The Messy Unwinding of the New World Order---in Charts
SUMMARY: The post-Cold War order promised a globe stitched together by markets and cooperation among nations. That system has fallen into disorder, and left the world with rising inflation, trade conflict, military confrontation and gnarled supply chains.

SUMMARY: Twitter is planning thousands of job cuts, and other companies are paring back after unprecedented growth during the pandemic.

SUMMARY: Albertsons previously said it would pay shareholders $4 billion on Nov. 7, announced when the supermarket chain agreed to merge with Kroger.

SUMMARY: The kingdom’s Public Investment Fund is partnering with the biggest assembler of Apple Inc. iPhones.

SUMMARY: The president of global affairs at Meta Platforms argues that the Facebook parent’s recent business struggles are overblown.

SUMMARY: The online house-flipper posted enormous losses in third quarter earnings as it struggled with weak sales in a market hit hard by interest rate increases.

TITLE: Robots? Some Companies Find Only Humans Can Do the Job

SUMMARY: The full-floor unit at 220 Central Park South is one of the priciest homes to sell this year.

SUMMARY: The U.S. oil giant is examining how it uses its sprawling Houston-area campus as part of an effort to cut billions in structural costs.

SUMMARY: The protest across 14 newsrooms follows recent layoffs and cost-cutting at the USA Today publisher.

SUMMARY: China agreed to approve BioNTech’s Covid-19 vaccines for foreign residents, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said, in what would mark the first mRNA vaccine for Covid-19 approved for use in China.

SUMMARY: The hip-hop mogul and entrepreneur is acquiring marijuana assets to be divested in the merger of Cresco Labs and Columbia Care.

SUMMARY: In an email to employees, the social-media company said the reductions were intended “to place Twitter on a healthy path.” The email didn’t spell out the extent of the cuts.

SUMMARY: After sharp growth from Covid, semiconductor executives are now enacting hiring pauses.

SUMMARY: The outlook for tech industry jobs worsened with ride-hailing company Lyft and payments company Stripe both announcing major layoffs and Amazon saying it will freeze corporate hiring for months.

SUMMARY: Utility company Dominion Energy intends to review its current business mix and capital allocation, and assess regulatory options to assist its customers with managing costs.

SUMMARY: After sharp growth during Covid, semiconductor executives now put hiring on pause and cut costs amid high inventory.

SUMMARY: Reselling sneakers afforded Michael Malekzadeh a gold-plated lifestyle until complaints and threats over unfilled orders brought his business to a full stop. “This is a Bernie Madoff-size scam for the sneaker market.”

SUMMARY: ‘Smaller increments will often be appropriate as we work to determine how much tightening is needed,’ said Boston Fed President Susan Collins

SUMMARY: The energy company’s announcement deals a setback to France’s efforts to ride out Europe’s energy crisis amid a spell of unseasonably warm weather.

SUMMARY: Cardinal Health Inc. said its top line rose 13% in its recently completed quarter, with gains for its pharmaceutical business offsetting a decline in its medical segment.

SUMMARY: Elon Musk tweeted that Twitter has had a massive drop in revenue due to activist groups pressuring advertisers, as the social-media company started sweeping layoffs just over a week after the billionaire took it over.

SUMMARY: America’s jobs market shows no meaningful sign of slumping despite recession fears and some high-profile anecdotes.

SUMMARY: The outlook for tech industry jobs worsened with ride-hailing company Lyft and payments company Stripe both announcing major layoffs and Amazon saying it will freeze corporate hiring for months.

SUMMARY: ‘Smaller increments will often be appropriate as we work to determine how much tightening is needed,’ said Boston Fed President Susan Collins

SUMMARY: Central bank identifies near-term threats in its Financial Stability Report.

SUMMARY: Most industries are still hiring workers as they seek to catch up with demand.

SUMMARY: Central bank identified near-term threats in its Financial Stability Report.

SUMMARY: The two men are accused of engaging in a fraudulent scheme to inflate the parent company’s stock and attract new shareholders.

SUMMARY: Nike moved to distance itself from the basketball star after he was suspended by his team for being slow to disavow anti-Semitism.

SUMMARY: The ruling paves the way for Fox Corp. to take a bigger position in the fast-growing sports-betting industry.

SUMMARY: The regulator alleges the club was a crypto Ponzi scheme that raised bitcoins from investors around the world.

SUMMARY: Musk’s strategy at Twitter might work at a startup, but Twitter is a mature company in an extremely competitive market, with little prospects for growth.

SUMMARY: Inside Twitter Inc. in the week after Elon Musk took it over, almost no one seemed to know for sure what was going on.

SUMMARY: Twitter Inc. said it has begun rolling out software updates to charge users $7.99 a month to mark their accounts with a blue checkmark, part of Elon Musk’s early efforts to boost revenue a little more than a week after taking ownership of the social-media network.

SUMMARY: The industry is seeking influence in Washington as regulators increase their scrutiny of digital assets.

SUMMARY: The duo helped the former Nissan executive avoid a trial on charges of financial wrongdoing in Japan.

SUMMARY: In his first week at Twitter, the billionaire fired top leaders, conducted sweeping layoffs and hinted that other changes could be on the way.

SUMMARY: Geopolitical and economic upheaval has stalled progress and led to backsliding by some measures over the past year, but countries are spending more to address climate change.

SUMMARY: U.S. oil-and-gas companies offer little relief for tight global market.

SUMMARY: Amazon has long had one of the most successful subscription programs but is seeking to offer more as competitors gain ground.

SUMMARY: Consumers are swapping everything from Lululemon leggings to Natori underwear for cheaper alternatives: “A $12 bra is good enough.”

SUMMARY: After multiyear surges, property prices in Australia, Canada and New Zealand are at particular risk.

SUMMARY: Industry executives say Americans’ appetite for travel and entertainment remains strong, as desires to spend on experiences overcome concerns about inflation and the economy.
